item.title: Random Spin Committee Approach For Smooth Interatomic Potentials
item.description: arXiv:2410.16252v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Training interatomic potentials for spin-polarized systems continues to be a difficult task for the molecular modeling community. In this note, a proof-of-concept, random initial spin committee approach is proposed for obtaining the ground state of spin-polarized systems with a controllable degree of accuracy. The approach is tested on two toy models of elemental sulfur where the exact optimal spin configuration can be known. Machine-learning potentials are trained on the resulting data, and increasingly accurate fits with respect to the ground state are achieved, marking a step towards machine-learning force fields for general bulk spin-polarized systems.
item.dc:creator: Vlad C\u{a}rare, Volker L. Deringer, G\'abor Cs\'anyi
